intro: network protocols, cli, linux, fuse fs, nss, shell, perl, latin, toki pona, etimology, math, q-physics, diy repairment

post.body:
hi zero people! i've just created my first zite. [check it out!](/1NV2twiBAk1Tr1x8sRUZH9nRNvigFMZDyn)

EDITED: clickable link
where is ZeroTalk's issue tracker? i like to suggest search feature and pager for it.

hi people, i've put together a zite to share my public folder. curious whether it works. currently there're music in it, sorry for the temporary lack of order and non English file names, anyway you will find out your favorite band's name :) [check it out](/15YojpsjvfowC2Jixt1VT9Nvocu8wUMNAL)

I started to implement "zeronet-fuse": a pseudo filesystem you can mount via FUSE subsystem an by which you can browse Zeronet sites directory tree like your local files. the benefit contrary to simply browsing zeronet data directory directly is that it lists and downloads optional files when you first access them. 

https://github.com/bAndie91/tools/tree/execfuse/zeronet/usr/libexec/execfuse/zeronet
it is based on [execfuse](https://github.com/vi/execfuse).

opinions?

comment.body: @Geekless: it's strange, ZHello show me you commented this: "Magyar?", but i can not see under my post, only your other comment with the clickable link. for which i say thanks :) btw is not it an easy feature to auto linkify strings matching to Zite/bitcoin address pattern? and yes, i'm Magyar :)
@Geekless: ahh this one! :D yeah i've hid it and did not consider to be mine :) cool. i'm getting in :)
so this is naughty feature to peek the user's locale settings :)
@Geekless: i see. makes sense. let me try markdown ... [check it out](/1NV2twiBAk1Tr1x8sRUZH9nRNvigFMZDyn)
ok, sorry for the early announcement. i checked it on a proxy site and it tourned out that zeronet does not traverse across symlinks, so no content yet :-/

alright. I managed to replace few directory symlinks to much many hardlinks to all the files, so zeronet started to include them in content.json. however it does not cope with multibyte (unicode) char filenames. please see my zite anyway :)
i recommend [this folder](/15YojpsjvfowC2Jixt1VT9Nvocu8wUMNAL/files/#./zene/kulfoldi-rock) with music from English speaking areas in it.
@caryoscelus: thanks for your attention. yeah I neither find any trend for not-web oriented zites, despite, IMO we have to use zeronet's capability of serving simple directory trees.
@caryoscelus: "use of db" - I'm not entirely sure which database is to be used for what
